Feb 28

The Charlotte 49ers see two players move on to Major League Soccer

If you haven’t been out to UNCC’s Transamerica Field lately, you’re missing out on some quality soccer in Charlotte, NC. In fact, you’re missing out on MLS-quality soccer as, this week, two Charlotte 49ers signed contracts with the Chicago Fire and will be playing at Toyota Park in 2017.

49er standouts Brandt Bronico and Matej Dekovic will continue to play together after college: both were drafted by the Fire in the MLS SuperDraft back in January, and both impressed enough in preseason to earn contracts. The duo are signed for the 2017 season with annual club options through 2020.

With that sort of contract, not uncommon in MLS, they’ll need to prove their worth year in and year out and may see stints at the Fire’s USL affiliate in Tulsa throughout the year.

For Bronico, the challenge to make the first team will be one he welcomes with open arms: “I want to be more successful than you do” is the highlight of his Twitter bio…

Brandt Bronico (@Bronibro13) | Twitter
The latest Tweets from Brandt Bronico (@Bronibro13). I want to be successful more than you do. Professional soccer…twitter.com

And he certainly was successful as a midfielder at UNC-Charlotte. Bronico scored 25 goals and had 23 assists in his time in green and white, earned the Conference USA Player of the Year award, and put in four game-winners in his senior season.

He’s a local boy from High Point, NC, and led Wesleyan Christian Academy to the state title in 2012 and 2013. He also played for Carolina Dynamo in the PDL.

Bronico was selected 47th overall in the draft, in the middle of the third round and 22 spots ahead of his teammate, Matej Dekovic.

Dekovic is a Croatian defender who played three seasons at UNCC. He made the Conference USA All-Freshman team in 2014 and really shined in his final season in green and white, earning NSCAA First Team All-Southeast Region, First Team All-Conference USA, and NCCSIA First Team All-State accolades in 2016.

Fire GM Nelson Rodríguez had this to say about his two 49ers signees:

“Brandt has demonstrated composure on the ball, good tactical awareness and the willingness to work tirelessly. His performances in training and games warranted this contract and suggest that he will compete for playing time this season. Matej’s versatility as a central and outside back is an asset. He is a good 1v1 defender who is also good in the aerial game.”

Here’s hoping both get playing time in Chicago. If they do make Veljko Paunović’s gameday squad, they’ll make their return to the Southeast when the Fire play at Atlanta United on Saturday, March 18th. Good luck, boys.
